title: Altstadtsommer 2025 - Bad Belzig
subtitle: Three days of music, food, and open courtyards in the historic old town
author: The Fläming Eck

image.alt: Night view of Bad Belzig market square with festival lights and crowd

content.text: Altstadtsommer 2025 returns to Bad Belzig from 29–31 August. For three days, the historic old town will be filled with music, food, and open courtyards. Entry is free, making it one of the most accessible and vibrant cultural festivals in the Hoher Fläming.

The main stage on the Marktplatz will host headline acts including Fun Factory, Anstandslos & Durchgeknallt, Sonia Liebing, Neonlicht, and Right Now. From classical ensembles to DJs spinning late into the night, the programme offers something for every taste.

Beyond the main stage, visitors can explore a dozen courtyards, each with its own atmosphere—from family-friendly activities and local food to late-night beats. Highlights include the Alter Brauhof, Die Gute Stube, and the Rotes Wohnzimmer.
Bad Belzig is easy to reach by train (RE7 direct from Berlin and Dessau), and local buses are free throughout the festival weekend. A full programme with courtyard map is available online.
